top_comments.comment: Seventy thousand dollars of jewelry, family jewelry that's been passed down no less, just sitting out in the open? And you need to be told to put that away when you vacate your house, leaving it in the hands of strangers? Sounds like it's time to start investing in some common sense.
That's what happens when everyone has to wear masks
I’m the person in those houses

comments_since_last_sample.body: Ohhh… from the title i assumed thieves were putting exterminator tents over houses while they robbed them..
I didn't know exterminators were supposed to also be security guards
If the thieves die due to chemical exposure. Don't feel bad,that's what poison is suppose to do,get rid of vermin.
Another beautiful example of no fault society 👌
I’m the person in those houses
This has been in so many TV shows and movies with a criminal protagonist. Just too easy. I pack up everything when I have to call a plumber. Call an exterminator…it’ll look like I’ve moved out.
Heyyyy what's a tent full of toxins to a METH HEAD 🙄
Hold up? She never secured her valuable belongings? And last time I had my place hals assed fumigated (I like in an apartment next to nasty neighbors) I packed up everything that was in the open

For me its common sense, you're leaving your house, trusting it to other people without securing your valuables? Come on.
Also to blame the company for not reminding you that? Wow!
